channel.title: Range Help

item.title: Range Help
item.dc:creator: @Scarr Scarr
item.description:
@Scarr wrote:

Thank you so much Zubmage, you’ve been a big help. I just got one more tiny question. I added this code:
The int arrow = playerEquipment[playerArrows]; deleteItem(arrow, playerEquipment[playerArrows], 1 ); is what I added to that to get my arrows to delete from the equipped inventory. It won’t work, what I mean is you could have 1 Rune Arrow and have infinite. It shows it on the ground but it isn’t gone from the equipped inventory screen.

if(UseBow){ inCombat(); teleXY(); inCombat(); teleXY(); CheckArrows(); int arrow = playerEquipment[playerArrows]; deleteItem(arrow, playerEquipment[playerArrows], 1); CalculateRangePlayer(AttackingOn); hitDiff = misc.random(playerMaxHitRange); } else { PkingDelay = 6; wepdelay = 6; }

AAAAAAAAAH! The getstandanim still doesn’t work! I’m about to go berserk!

Read full topic

item.title: Range Help
item.dc:creator: @zubmage zubmage
item.description:
@zubmage wrote:

You want to add this in:

if(id == 861) //Custom Bow. { return 426; }

item.title: Range Help
item.dc:creator: @Scarr Scarr
item.description:
@Scarr wrote:

Thanks guys, I appreciate it. Ugh, I searched in client.java for getstandanim. I found it, here’s the code but there’s no // bows anywhere?? Do I add it? Or what? It’s not in the // 2h either but it’s still wielded like one when I stand still.

public int GetStandAnim(int id) { if(id == 1305 || id == 1379 || id == 1381 || id == 1383 || id == 1385 || id == 1387 || id == 1389 || id == 1391 || id == 1393 || id == 1395 || id == 1397 || id == 1399 || id == 1401 || id == 1403 || id == 145 || id == 1407 || id == 1409 || id == 3053 || id == 3054 || id == 4170 || id == 4675 || id == 4710 || id == 6526 || id == 4726 || id == 6562 || id == 6563 || id == 5730) // staves { return 2061; } if(id == 4718) { return 2065; }// dharoks axe if(id == 4755) { return 2061; }// veracs flail if(id == 4734) { return 2074; }// karils x bow if(id == 4153) { return 1662; }// maul if(id == 4565) { return 1836; }// basket of eggs :) if(id == 7158 || id == 7449 || id == 9036 || id == 9038) { return 2065; }// 2h if(id == 3204 || id == 1393 || id == 1395 || id == 1397 || id == 1399 || id == 3053 || id == 4675 || id ==6914) { return 809; }// Staffs else { return ServerCP.standemote; } }

Read full topic

item.title: Range Help
item.dc:creator: @zubmage zubmage
item.description:
@zubmage wrote:

The setAnimation(426) refers to how the weapon attacks, you are asking how it holds.

Add the item into Getstandanim.

Read full topic

item.title: Range Help
item.dc:creator: @Scarr Scarr
item.description:
@Scarr wrote:

Well, I found out where and how my bow is wielded in my client.java, I changed the Animation to 426. But he still holds it like a Rune 2h. Here’s my code. Any idea why?

if(playerEquipment[playerWeapon] == 859 || playerEquipment[playerWeapon] == 861 || playerEquipment[playerWeapon] == 4214) { setAnimation(426); teleportToX = absX; teleportToY = absY; }

Read full topic
